p: Expansion of host species to include primates has raised concerns about a potential risk of CDV infection in humans. It has been demonstrated in vitro that the monkey-adapted strain (CYN07-dV) has an intrinsic ability to use human nectin-4 for virus entry and easily become adapted to use the human CD150 following minimal amino acid changes of the viral H protein [125]. Thus, species jumps to human beings, especially in people with a lack of cross-protective measles immunity are proposed to happen in the future [12], [126], [127]. Moreover, the participation of CDV in the pathogenesis of Paget's disease of bone and multiple sclerosis in human beings has been speculated but lacks final verification [3], [128].
